page.title: 02BARNARDISTON HALL
page.content: Barnardiston Hall has the same name as the first owners, who lived at nearby Kedington. Samuel Barnardiston was the first to be called "Roundhead" during the Civil War. Before the Hall was built there was a manor-type farmhouse on a nearby site. The Hall is moated and in the grounds is a barn (1854) with a slate roof. The present Hall was built in 1897 by Lord Malcolm of Portalloch who only lived for a year after its completion. His widow lived alone here after his death and had stables built to house old horses. In 1927 the Hall became part of the Thurlow Estates owned by Charles Ryder. The Estate was bought by R. A. Vestey in 1942. The Hall and 16 acres were bought by Mrs. S.A.Kiddy in July 1969 and became a school in January 1970.
